caption.p: Inventory of ethnoveterinary plants in Qianxinan Prefecture

tr.td: A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for throat trouble.
Dry roots are boiled and orally given to livestock for rheumatism.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of urethral disorder.
Roots are boiled and orally given to livestock for gastropathy.
Along with Argyreia acuta and Coptis chinensis, fresh leaves are boiled and orally given to livestock for prevention the foot-and-mouth disease virus.
Fresh leaves are taken and crushed and made rake to cattle for treatment of fracture.
Roots are boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of fracture.
Along with Ampelopsis delavayana and Coptis chinensis, fresh leaves are boiled and orally given to livestock for prevention the foot-and-mouth disease virus.
Fresh leaves are taken and crushed, and after that, are combined with fresh ginger and rubbed on cattle’s external tongue for oral disease and as anthelmintic.
Root of the herb is boiled and orally given to livestock for prevention respiratory ailments.
Peel is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of hydropsy.
Fresh leaves are taken and crushed, and after that, are combined with fresh ginger and Artemisia argyi and rubbed on cattle’s external tongue for oral disease.
The whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of fractures.
Fresh root of the herb is crushed and made to paste and coated afflicted part. This is also used to treat genital infection and problems.
Fresh root of the herb is crushed and made to paste and coated afflicted part.
Along with Polygonum perfoliatum, a whole plant boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of urinary trouble.
Fresh fruits of the herb are crushed and mixed with fodder for the expulsion of intestinal worms and treated gastric problems
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to cattle for treatment of pneumonia.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of cough and heat-clearing and detoxifying.
Root of the herb is crushed and applied to livestock for treatment of wound.
Decoction is made from its fruits and orally administered to cattle for the treatment of cough.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of retained placenta.

td.italic: Lespedeza juncea var. sericea (Thunb.) Lace & Hauech

tr.td: Decoction is made from it stems and given orally to livestock for treatment of lung infections.
Along with Leonurus japonicus, Angelica sinensis, and Codonopsis pilosula, dry roots are boiled and orally given to livestock for the retained placental removal.
Along with fresh leaves from Solanum spirale and fresh leaves are boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of pulmonary infection.
Decoction is made from it aerial parts and rally given to livestock for treatment of pulmonary infection.
Root of the herb is crushed and applied to livestock for wound.
Decoction is made from its roots, and then, it is combined with fodder, given orally to livestock for heat-clearing and detoxifying.
Dry leaves of herb is chopped, then boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of gasteremphraxis.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment cough and heat-clearing and detoxifying.
Along with cymbopogon citratus, a whole plant boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of urinary trouble.
Fresh leaves are boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of pulmonary infection.
Root of the herb is crushed and applied to livestock for treatment of fracture.
A whole plant is crushed and applied to livestock for treatment of fracture.
Fresh stem of the herb is crushed and mixed with fodder, then orally given to livestock as anthelmintic.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of pulmonary infection.
Fresh leaves of the herb is crushed and applied to livestock for treatment of fracture.
Fresh vine of the herb is chipped dicing and mixed fodder, then orally given to livestock for promote digestion.
Plant leaves and seeds are subjected to decoction and used topically for skin problems.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of toothache.
Power dry bulb of the herb is boiled and orally given for the treatment of stomach trouble.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of hepatitis.
Plant stems are subjected to decoction and used topically used for general body improvement.
Fresh leaves of the herb is crushed and applied to livestock for treatment of fracture.
Fresh stem are taken and decoction is made and orally given to livestock for abirritation.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for prevention of common cold.
Xanthium strumarium subsp. sibiricum (Patrin ex Widder) Greuter
Along with sulfur, dry fruits are powered and coated for treatment of fungal infection.
Bulb is crushed and mixed with fodder and orally given to livestock for promotion stomach digestion and against digestive disorders, for flatulence, and as appetizer.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of respiratory infection.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of pulmonary infection.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of diarrhea.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of gastric and throat troubles.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of throat troubles.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of respiratory troubles.
Along with Ampelopsis delavayana and Argyreia acuta, fresh roots are boiled and orally given to livestock for prevention the foot-and-mouth disease virus.
Fresh leaves are taken and decoction is made, and after that, the decoction is combined with Lonicera japonica and is used for livestock cold.
Decoction is made from its roots, and then rubbed on animal’s external tongue for prevention of foot-and-mouth disease virus.
Dry roots are boiled and orally given to cattle for treatment of diarrhea, along with dry root of Bletilla striata and Mahonia fortunei.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of diarrhea.
Decoction is made from its roots and orally given to livestock for treatment of diarrhea.
Decoction is made from its rhizomes, and orally given to livestock for curing gastric distension.
Fresh root of the herb is crushed and made to paste and coated to afflicted part.
Fresh root of the herb is crushed and mixed with made to paste and coated to afflicted part.
Decoction is made from its roots and orally given to livestock for treatment of inflammation.
Decoction is made from its roots and orally given to livestock for treatment of inflammation.
Decoction is made from its roots and orally given to livestock for treatment of inflammation.
Decoction is made from its peel fruit, and mixed peel fruit form Citrus aurantium, and after that orally given to livestock to help digestion.
Decoction is made from its peel fruit, and mixed peel fruit form Citrus reticulata, and after that orally given to livestock to help digestion.
Powder of its roots is orally given for the treatment of cough.
Roots are crushed and given to livestock for fracture.
Decoction is made from the whole plant, and orally given to livestock for hepatitis.
A whole plant is boiled and orally given to livestock for treatment of liver parasite.
Grinds mung beans and mixes with vegetable oil, then orally given to pig for treatment of nitrite poisoning.
Decoction is made from its malt, and orally given to livestock for curing digestive complaints.
Seed of the herb is fried and orally given to cattle for treatment of ruminal impaction.
Fresh roots of the herb is crushed and orally given to cattle for treatment of ruminal impaction.
Decoction is made from its rhizomes, and orally given to livestock for treatment of gastric distension.
Decoction is made from its fruit, and orally given to livestock for curing gastric distension.
Decoction is made from its fruit, and orally given to livestock for invigorating stomach.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for curing digestive complaints.
Decoction is made from its bulb, and orally given to goat for diuretic swelling.
Powder of its stem is boiled and orally given to livestock for diureses and promoting lactation.
Ligusticum tachiroei (Franch. & Sav.) M. Hiroe & Constance
Decoction is made from its bulb, and orally given to livestock for treatment of traumatic injury.
Roots are crushed and given to livestock for fracture.
Roots are crushed and given to livestock for fracture.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of gaseous distention.
Fresh leaves of the herb is crushed and mixed with fodder and applied to livestock for treatment of lung complexities.
Dry resin of herb is coated to livestock for exterior wound and sore throat.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for general body improvement.
Powder of its roots is boiled and orally given for the treatment of stomach problems.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of digestive tract problem.
Powder of its roots is orally given to animals, i.e., goat, sheep, and cow as tonic.
Powder of its roots is boiled and orally given for treatment sore throat.
Powder of its roots is boiled and orally given for treatment of stomachache. Powder is made and combined with flour which is used as tonic and for the treatment of cough in goat and cow.
Powder of its peel is boiled and orally given for treatment of stomachache and the removal worms.
Powder of its seed is orally given to livestock for the removal of worms and disperse accumulation.
Seed of the herb is fried and evigated, then mixed with fodder and orally given for the expulsion of intestinal roundworm.

Powder of its roots is orally given to animals, i.e., goat, sheep, for treatment of infection. Bulb is crushed and mixed with way to administered orally in order to rate of fertility in domestic animals.
Along with fodder, root of the herb is crushed and applied to livestock for tonic.
Decoction is made from its fruits, and orally given to cattle for treatment of ruminal impaction.
Decoction is made from its barks, and orally given to cattle for treatment of ruminal impaction.
Powder of its roots is orally given to foal for treatment diarrhoea.
Fresh leaves of the herb is crushed and orally given to cattle for treatment of ruminal impaction.
Fruits of the herb are fried and evigated, then mixed with fodder and orally given for treatment of bilharziasis.
Fresh leaves of the herb is crushed and orally given to cattle for treatment of ruminal impaction.

Powder of its seed is orally given to livestock for embellish aperient bowel function flour. This remedy is given to domestic animals as refrigerant and also given to the cattle suffering for genital prolapsed.
Soybean milk is made from the herb and orally given to livestock for treatment of salt poisoning.
Powder is made from flowers and applied topically to all domestic animals to treat dermal problems, as anti-inflammatory.
Decoction is made from it fresh stem and given orally to livestock for appetite.
Powder is made from whole plant and applied topically to all domestic animals to treat dermal problems, as anti-inflammatory.
Decoction is made from it fresh stem and given orally to cattle against cough, fever, and pain.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to livestock for treatment of diarrhea.
Along with bark of Quercus acutissima, decoction is made from its roots and given orally to cattle against diarrhea.
Fresh leaves decoction is orally given for gastric troubles and as diuretic.
Decoction is made from its roots, and orally given to cattle for treatment of urinary tract infections.

To relieve the external parasite, the decoction of its leaves is used for animal bathing especially goat and cow. Decoction is made from its leaves, and it is applied externally on animal’s body and then rubbed for external parasites. Infusion of its leaves is drenched via nostrils against leech infestation in cows.
Fresh leaves of the herb is crushed and placed on wound for blood clotting.
Decoction is made from its roots and orally given to cattle for poisoned by Cyclobalanopsis green leaves.
First make a paste of stem and external application to livestock for wound healing process.
Along with root of Fallopia multiflora, decoction of its bark is given orally daily to livestock for diarrhea.
Libanotis seseloides (Fisch. & C.A. Mey. ex Turcz.) Turcz.
Decoction of its leaves is given orally to horse for the treatment of cough.
Decoction is made from its fruits and boiled, then orally given to livestock for treatment diarrhea.
